Hoffman’s appointment follows the planned retirement of COO Steve Erb, who will retire on March 13, 2026, after an esteemed 40-year career in banking, including 12…

articles.title: Nikki Hoffman promoted to Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer at People’s Bank

February 3, 2026 – PBCO Financial Corporation (OTCPK: “PBCO”), the holding company (Company) of People’s Bank of Commerce (Bank), today announced that it has declared a cash dividend of $0.25 per share, approximately 15% of 2025 net income. The $0.25 dividend will be paid on March 5, 2026, to shareholders of record February 18, 2026.…

articles.title: PBCO Announces Cash Dividend

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Sunrise Enterprises has been named Best Secondhand Store in Douglas County for the fifth year in a row for the 2025 Readers' Choice Award. The recognition reflects decades of community support for a mission focused on inclusion, opportunity, and meaningful employment since 1969.
articles.title: Five Years in a Row: Sunrise Enterprises Recognized as Best Secondhand Store in Douglas County

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Umpqua National Forest will switch to cashless fee collection at developed recreation sites beginning April 1, 2026. Visitors will need to use Scan & Pay or Recreation.gov, with cash and checks no longer accepted at Forest Service sites.
articles.title: Umpqua National Forest Moves to Cashless Fees at Recreation Sites Starting April 1

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Police responded to multiple incidents on Feb. 2, 2026, including several warrant arrests, a non-injury traffic crash, a prohibited camping citation, a parole violation, and a driving-while-suspended case. All information was released by RPD.
articles.title: Police Log: February 2, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Police responded to reports of gunfire in a Sutherlin neighborhood Monday afternoon. Officers later found an elderly woman deceased inside a residence. Authorities say there is no ongoing threat to the public.
articles.title: One Person Found Deceased After Gunfire Reported in Sutherlin

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: February 3, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A 19-year-old Wilbur man has been arrested following a Winston Police investigation into an alleged drive-by shooting reported in January. Officers executed search warrants, seized a firearm, and lodged the suspect in the Douglas County Jail on multiple charges.
articles.title: Winston Police Arrest 19-Year-Old in Connection With Alleged Drive-By Shooting

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Pre-K students from Looking Glass Elementary stepped into the kitchen at Domino’s in Winston on Jan. 28 for a hands-on pizza school. Owner Angelique Martinez taught kids about food, creativity, and how many paths can lead to success.
articles.title: Winston Pre-K Students Learn About Food and Creativity During Domino’s Pizza School

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A college founded by the inventor of the modern service dog is now based in Canyonville. Bergin College of Canine Studies trains service dogs for those in need, including Veterans, and is seeking local volunteers to help raise puppies now entering training.
articles.title: The College Founded by the Inventor of the Service Dog Is Right Here in Douglas County; Puppy Raisers Needed

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man was arrested on arson charges following a January incident involving a reported natural gas leak at an apartment on SE Kane Street. Investigators say fire damage was found near a kitchen range and a gas line had been removed.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Charged With First-Degree Arson After Reported Gas Leak at Apartment

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Police handled dozens of incidents between Jan. 30 and Feb. 2, including arrests for warrants, DUII, theft, probation violations, prohibited camping, and disorderly conduct. Several citations and custodial bookings were reported across the city.
articles.title: Police Log: January 30 - February 2, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County 4-H and Farmers Co-Op will host a free Market Goat and Market Swine Selection & Feed Planning seminar on March 11 at the Douglas County Extension Office. Open to 4-H and FFA youth and families. Registration required.
articles.title: Douglas County 4-H, Farmers Co-Op to Host Market Goat & Swine Seminar

articles.description: A Douglas County Hope Drug Court graduate is making a difference in the community with the "Food for Hope Community Project" in Roseburg this weekend.
articles.title: Roseburg's Hope Drug Court grads tackle hunger with community project

articles.title: New cashless system for Umpqua Forest recreation sites starts April
